title: Microsoft replaces Apple as the world's most valuable company
text: Hong Kong equity market rebounds, regains 4th position as the largest market from India Border-Gavaskar Trophy between India and Australia extended to 5 Tests BJP president JP Nadda's wife's car stolen from Delhi's Govindpuri Public sector banks' dividend payout may exceed Rs 15,000 cr in FY24 Hardik batting at 7 was a collective decision, not his alone: Pollard Taapsee Pannu marries longtime boyfriend Mathias Boe in Udaipur, co-actor Pavail Gulati shares pic Paytm UPI transaction decline to persist until new customer addition Holi 2024: Combat post festive season weight gain with these detox tips Editorji News Desk Microsoft on Thursday replaced Apple as the most valuable company in the world. The tech giant has achieved this feat for the first time since 2021. The market capitalisation of the company has reached $2.87 trillion. Azure, Microsoft's cloud computing platform has become a dominant force challenging Amazon Web Services for market share. In the last quarter, Azure's revenue soared 40% year-over-year. Also Read: Apple's earnings boosting strategy; here's how the subtle price rise works Microsoft shares have also gotten a boost since last year after the company's early lead in generative artificial intelligence when it invested in ChatGPT-maker OpenAI. Meanwhile Apple's shares were 0.9% lower on Thursday. The company is also facing an antitrust case from the US Department of Justice. Foxconn has also seen its year-on-year decline in revenue. Analysts have also downgraded Apple's stock citing lacklustre iPhone15 sales in China. However, Apple has scope to recover from its losses as it is preparing to launch its next big product VisionPro.
